title: Calories in Kirkland Mixed Nuts
meta_description: Learn calories in Kirkland mixed nuts per 1 oz serving, including full nutrition facts for fats, protein, carbs, and healthy tweaks for your snack.
assumptions: Kirkland Signature mixed nuts (almonds, cashews, pecans, Brazil nuts, macadamia nuts), dry roasted, unsalted; standard 1 oz (28 g) serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by exact mix, roasting method, salt content, and brand batch. Check packaging for precise values.

quick_answer.text: One ounce of Kirkland mixed nuts provides about 180 kcal and 5 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Salted version (adds sodium but minimal calories)
Add 1 tsp honey coating per oz

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 oz of Kirkland mixed nuts?
What is the fat content in Kirkland mixed nuts?
faqs.a: About 16 g total fat per oz, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: Are Kirkland mixed nuts high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, around 5 g protein per 1 oz serving from nuts like almonds and cashews.

faqs.q: Do Kirkland mixed nuts have added sugar?
faqs.a: Natural sugars only, about 1 g per oz; no added sugars in the standard mix.

faqs.q: How does portion size affect calories in Kirkland mixed nuts?
faqs.a: Each additional oz adds ~180 kcal; stick to 1 oz for controlled snacking.
